column4: ok- I've set a VPN up with my ubuntu box being the server and a vista client. So when I try to run utorrent on it, it doesn't seem to get past like 15Kb on avg, though my upload is quite fierce, and I am apparently "not connectable: a firewall/router is limiting my network traffic". My ports are open and all that; could it be ubuntu's firewall?
what kind of conenction is it? NAT?
don't mean to press, but in case you didn't see, my vpn is over tcp. my place here in the uk blocks udp.
dunno sorry. I thought it could be a problem with the client to host connection but I don't know anymore
